cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to recurve northeastward across the southeastern United States toward the Carolinas/Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast (near the Louisiana/Mississippi coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None affecting Virginia; tropical storm watches/warnings confined to Intracoastal City, LA, eastward to the AL/FL border and adjacent bays/lakes
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Intracoastal City, Louisiana, to the Alabama/Florida border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast and, after landfall, interior portions of the Deep South and Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: No Virginia-area site listed in Advisory #1 wind-probability table
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance suggests <4" for southeast Virginia)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds (20–30 mph) possible as the remnant low passes inland well to the south and west
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Virginia coast from this system
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate rain (1–2") possible early next week as the remnant moves offshore to the south of the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornado risk inland south of the port; otherwise none significant for port operations
